channel.title: .NET on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in .NET on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: dotnet: The Dongle Died at Midnight – WinForms Agent Saved my German Mom’s Business Trip
item.description:
A .NET Blog post describing how the author used a WinForms agent/AI-assisted development workflow to quickly build a replacement time-study app after a hardware dongle failed during a business trip.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: .NET and .NET Framework February 2026 servicing releases updates
item.description:
Recap post for February 2026 servicing updates across .NET and .NET Framework.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: ai: Building an AI Skills Executor in .NET: Bringing Anthropic’s Agent Pattern to the Microsoft Ecosystem
item.description:
Guest post outlining how to implement an “AI Skills Executor” in .NET using Azure OpenAI and the Model Context Protocol (MCP) C# SDK to replicate Anthropic-style agent patterns.

  • Source: Microsoft AI Foundry Blog

item.title: github: CodeQL 2.24.0 adds Swift 6.2 and .NET 10 support, and improves file handling for minified JavaScript
item.description:
CodeQL 2.24.0 is a new release of the static analysis engine used by GitHub code scanning. This update adds support for Swift 6.2, compatibility with .NET 10, and improves file handling for minified JavaScript to help detection and analysis of issues in those languages.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: .NET AI Essentials – The Core Building Blocks Explained
item.description:
The article introduces Microsoft.Extensions.AI, a unified, provider-agnostic API for building intelligent .NET applications that work with any LLM provider. It highlights a single interface that simplifies integration and includes built-in middleware, telemetry, structured outputs, and other capabilities to streamline AI development in .NET.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Join Microsoft at NDC London 2026 – Let’s Build the Future of .NET Together
item.description:
Microsoft invites developers to meet the .NET team at NDC London 2026 to explore .NET 10, Azure, and AI-powered development through sessions and 1:1 meetups.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: How We Synchronize .NET’s Virtual Monorepo
item.description:
A technical deep dive describing how the .NET team keeps product repositories synchronized with a Virtual Monolithic Repository. It explains the custom two-way synchronization algorithm and the engineering challenges encountered while maintaining consistency across many repositories.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Secure and Intelligent: Queryable Encryption and Vector Search in MongoDB EF Core Provider
item.description:
The MongoDB EF Core provider adds support for Queryable Encryption and Vector Search, letting .NET developers encrypt sensitive data while still running queries against it and build AI-powered semantic search applications directly using EF Core.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Top .NET Videos & Live Streams of 2025
item.description:
A brief roundup on the .NET Blog highlighting the standout .NET videos, events, and live streams from 2025.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Top .NET Blog Posts of 2025
item.description:
A year-end roundup of the most-read .NET blog posts published in 2025, highlighting coverage of .NET 10, AI in .NET, performance improvements, and developer tooling, with links back to the original .NET Blog.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Microsoft.Testing.Platform Now Fully Supported in Azure DevOps
item.description:
Azure DevOps now fully supports Microsoft.Testing.Platform, enabling teams to run tests and publish test results directly within Azure DevOps pipelines and workflows. The update improves integration between the testing platform and Azure DevOps for streamlined test execution and reporting.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: How to Build iOS Widgets with .NET MAUI
item.description:
A how-to article showing developers how to build iOS widgets using .NET MAUI, covering creation of widgets ranging from simple static displays to richer interactive experiences.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: .NET and .NET Framework December 2025 servicing releases updates
item.description:
A brief recap of the December 2025 servicing updates for both .NET and .NET Framework, posted on the .NET Blog.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Microsoft Learn MCP Server Elevates Development
item.description:
Microsoft’s Learn MCP server improves the Copilot developer experience by providing practical examples and clear integration steps for Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, the Copilot CLI, and the Copilot Coding Agent.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Introducing Data Ingestion Building Blocks (Preview)
item.description:
Microsoft announced a preview of open, modular Data Ingestion Building Blocks for .NET that help developers create scalable AI data pipelines with easy getting-started experiences, extensibility, and tight integration in the .NET ecosystem.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: .NET Day on Agentic Modernization Coming Soon
item.description:
A live event on December 9 will showcase practical approaches to modernize .NET applications using Azure, AI, and agentic tooling. The announcement was posted on the .NET Blog.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Reinventing how .NET Builds and Ships (Again)
item.description:
The article describes how the .NET team replaced a complex distributed build system with a Unified Build approach. This change significantly simplified the build pipeline, cut build times, and made shipping .NET releases more flexible and predictable.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Supercharge Your Test Coverage with GitHub Copilot Testing for .NET
item.description:
GitHub Copilot Testing for .NET is now available in Visual Studio, allowing developers to automatically generate, build, and run high-quality unit tests across files, projects, or entire solutions to boost test coverage and speed up the testing workflow.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: A step-by-step guide to modernizing .NET applications with GitHub Copilot agent mode
item.description:
This .NET Blog post shows a step-by-step workflow using Visual Studio 2026 and GitHub Copilot agent mode to modernize .NET applications by upgrading .NET versions and frameworks, resolving build issues, and migrating apps to Azure with reduced manual effort.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Managed Instance on Azure App Service
item.description:
Azure announces Managed Instance on Azure App Service in Public Preview, a capability that simplifies lift-and-shift migrations of web apps (especially .NET) from on-premises or VMs to the cloud with minimal configuration and no code rewrites.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: Post-Quantum Cryptography in .NET
item.description:
A brief announcement on the .NET Blog describing new post-quantum cryptography (PQC) support in .NET. The post outlines what was added for PQC and explains the development path and decisions that led to those additions.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Introducing C# 14
item.description:
Announcement post introducing C# 14 and its features; C# 14 ships as part of .NET 10 and the full post is on the .NET Blog.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: .NET 10
item.description:
Microsoft announced .NET 10 is generally available, delivering a faster, more secure, and more capable platform for modern development. The release improves performance, productivity, and security across the stack, and C# 14 adds language refinements for more natural, expressive coding.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: .NET and .NET Framework November 2025 servicing releases updates
item.description:
A brief recap of the November 2025 servicing updates for .NET and .NET Framework, published on the .NET Blog.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Announcing Sponsorship on NuGet.org
item.description:
The .NET Blog announces a new Sponsorship feature on NuGet.org designed to help users recognize and support package maintainers and to strengthen the NuGet community.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Microsoft Entra ID token refresh code samples in Python and .NET
item.description:
Microsoft made generally available Python and .NET code samples demonstrating Entra ID token refresh for Azure Database for PostgreSQL to help securely manage authentication tokens when connecting with Entra ID.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: Preparing for the .NET 10 GC (DATAS)
item.description:
The .NET 10 Garbage Collector introduces DATAS, a new adaptive mechanism that adjusts heap size automatically. The article explains how DATAS behavior differs from the previous Server GC, and gives guidance on when to tune GC settings or disable DATAS depending on your application’s workload and performance goals.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Developer and AI Code Reviewer: Reviewing AI-Generated Code in .NET
item.description:
Practical guidance for reviewing AI-generated .NET code, emphasizing that AI output should be treated as a starting point and validated through tests, linters, security checks, and clear team processes to maintain quality and productivity.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Introducing Microsoft Agent Framework (Preview): Making AI Agents Simple for Every Developer
item.description:
Microsoft announced the Microsoft Agent Framework (Preview), a unified solution for creating, orchestrating, hosting, and observing AI agents in the .NET ecosystem to help developers ship production AI agents faster.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio — September update
item.description:
The September 2025 GitHub Copilot update for Visual Studio adds new Profiler and .NET Modernization agents, enhances MCP interactions, and introduces smarter code review capabilities to speed debugging, modernization, and developer workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Announcing Aspire 9.5
item.description:
Aspire 9.5 introduces a preview ‘aspire update’ command, single-file AppHost support, improved CLI and dashboard UX, and new integrations for AI, DevTunnels, and other tooling.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: GitHub Copilot app modernization capabilities for Java and .NET are now available
item.description:
Microsoft announced general availability of GitHub Copilot app modernization capabilities for Java and .NET. The offering is designed to reduce redundant, complex work involved in modernizing applications so developers can focus on innovation, while helping ensure apps remain secure, scalable, and up to date.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot app modernization is now generally available for Java and .NET
item.description:
GitHub Copilot app modernization is now generally available for Java and .NET projects. The feature helps teams assess applications, apply automated code transformations, patch builds, and containerize services quickly—reducing modernization work to days.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Prompt Files and Instructions Files Explained
item.description:
A .NET Blog post explaining how GitHub Copilot’s prompt files and instruction files help .NET developers guide and standardize AI-assisted code generation to improve productivity and consistency.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Application Insights Code Optimizations for .NET Apps
item.description:
Application Insights Code Optimizations for .NET Apps helps .NET developers detect performance bottlenecks and receive AI-driven code improvement suggestions via GitHub Copilot integration, streamlining diagnostics and optimizations within the .NET ecosystem.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Performance Improvements in .NET 10
item.description:
A blog post announcing and summarizing hundreds of performance improvements in .NET 10, offering a guided tour of enhancements across the platform to make apps faster, more memory-efficient, and more responsive.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Announcing .NET 10 Release Candidate 1
item.description:
.NET 10 Release Candidate 1 is now available, bringing improvements across the runtime, SDK, libraries, ASP.NET Core, Blazor, .NET MAUI, and more.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: .NET and .NET Framework September 2025 servicing releases updates
item.description:
This is a short recap announcing the September 2025 servicing updates for .NET and .NET Framework. The post summarizes the latest patches and maintenance updates and directs readers to the .NET Blog for full details and download guidance.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Let Copilot Coding Agent handle the busy work
item.description:
The .NET Blog post demonstrates how the GitHub Copilot Coding Agent automates repetitive developer tasks—like generating unit tests and implementing features from a PRD—using a real .NET sample, enabling developers to concentrate on design and code review.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: EFCore.Visualizer – View Entity Framework Core query plan inside Visual Studio
item.description:
EFCore.Visualizer is a Visual Studio extension that lets developers visualize and analyze Entity Framework Core query execution plans directly inside the IDE.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Roslyn Analyzer for Durable Functions in .NET isolated
item.description:
The Roslyn Analyzer for Durable Functions in the .NET isolated model is now available in public preview, providing real-time code analysis to enforce durable orchestration coding constraints.

  • Source: Azure Updates
